TopicTitle: What have you been playing recently? (Other than KSP)

Articles.Content:
Final update for Dunsfield, today I added two things. First, I added the newest part, which ironically is supposed to be the old city. This is where the old colony was set up. I used the base game's European district style for it.

Also, I added a new tower, a skyscraper off the workshop called the Twisted Tower Skyscraper (Link Here). I decided to name it XLjedi Tower, as an apology to @XLjedi for being a jerk to him.

Now it's one of the most prominent buildings in the skyline.

Edited July 23, 2023 by Kerbalsaurus
New page!

Frostpunk again.

My dear honorable citizens, you have every right to disagree with anything but can you please don't go duelling when there's -80℃ outside?

I have been playing FIFA 22. 

Couldn't get my hands on FIFA 23. Eagerly waiting for 24

On 7/23/2023 at 10:25 AM, Kerbalsaurus said:

Final update for Dunsfield, today I added two things. First, I added the newest part, which ironically is supposed to be the old city. This is where the old colony was set up. I used the base game's European district style for it.

Also, I added a new tower, a skyscraper off the workshop called the Twisted Tower Skyscraper (Link Here). I decided to name it XLjedi Tower, as an apology to @XLjedi for being a jerk to him.

Now it's one of the most prominent buildings in the skyline.

Nice.  What mods / add ons are you using?

35 minutes ago, JoeSchmuckatelli said:

Nice.  What mods / add ons are you using? 

Well, the European Theme for Old City is actually part of the game. The skyscraper is linked in the post. The Skyscrapers (besides the two front buildings) are from the Skyscrapers Content Creator Pack. Other than that, I just have quality of life mods like Enhanced Garbage Truck AI, Advanced Hearse AI, and Advanced Cemetery AI.

Edited July 24, 2023 by Kerbalsaurus

I just realised that I have a somewhat decent notebook available for testings, so why not for gaming?

So I decided to give a try for some indie developments that caught my attention lately.

For sandbox and building players that loves immersion but don't care for physics, Starship EVO appears to be a dream came true!

 

I'm also playing this new real physics one (but no building), rogue like game, Flight of Nova. Made me remind playing Elite Frontier and First Encounters. Very impressive graphics, by the way...

 

At last, but not the least, I'm revising an old "friend", Rodina. Last time I had played it was before my KSP times, and I'm happy the developer continued to develop it!

Diablo 4 - Processing
I started playing and already have a lvl 60 character in diablo 4, which was released relatively recently. i enjoy the gameplay, i really like the map for its atmosphere. i play as a mage mainly because of ice + electric. i don't seem to have any problems. upd:I added more pyro, because some people had unpleasant resistances I got this advice here

Edited August 10, 2023 by JohanFos

I've been playing Battlefront 2. Fortunately, I nabbed the Celebration Edition on Epic Games for free a few years back. That means I don't have to do any of EA's famed microtransactions to get characters I want! I'm a huge Star Wars fan, so its loads of fun being the characters and battling out in iconic locations. I've barely touched any of the Heroes and I only play as clone trooper characters.

I also play Among Us. Yes, I know, the dead, cringe, meme game. But it's still a lot of fun to play.

Edited August 4, 2023 by TwoCalories

8 hours ago, TwoCalories said:

I also play Among Us. Yes, I know, the dead, cringe, meme game. But it's still a lot of fun to play.

Only part that matters.  Don't let anyone, especially the internet at large, let you think it's not ok to play a game you like.

 

I've been putting what can only described as an unhealthy amount of time into Oxygen Not Included.

Again.
I also bought the new baldur gate 3. i really liked it, i will play it in parallel too!!!

Played more Battlefront 2 today.

This time its Starfighter Assault. While I absolutely suck at other infantry-based game modes, the sky is my domain. I guess it fits, for a KSP player, huh? 

I'm the one that got third place, TwelveCalories. That was my old username (older than TwoCalories) and I'm looking to change it.

I recently played Mirror's Edge. The original game. Not the sequel.
Actually I streamed my very first playthrough of it and I was very lucky that a (former?) speedrunner of the game occassionally helped me a bit. I was a bit... just a bit stupid at times, but I got through the game okay.

Unfortunately it's really not that long - I took around 5 hours. But it's a very lovely experience even almost 15 years later. The graphics are still absolutely stunning and beautiful and I've fallen in love with the soundtrack.

Got third in a match of Battlefront 2 today. That's a new record for me (in infantry-based game modes)!

In this picture, I was using a Heavy, but most of the match I played as a Specialist (sniper). Sniping's a pretty chill job because you can rack up kills without dying too much.

Edited August 8, 2023 by TwoCalories

I bought Darkest Dungeon 2 on the Steam Summer Sale, but hadn't had a chance to try it until last week.

It actually took a bit for me to get into it, mostly because I absolutely LOVED the original and this one is so different. However, I stuck with it and am glad I did. Once I stopped wanting to play the original (which I can always do by just playing it), I realized that it's nice to have a WHOLE DIFFERENT game with the same basic combat mechanics yet everything else changed.
Played more BF2 today. Got second!

I just finished the System Shock remake... Man, what a ride. It felt very true to the original while still being its own thing, really took me back almost thirty years but without the janky Ultima Underworld interface that killed every attempt of mine to replay the original. Very well done, although I still prefer the original intro and outro music.

Edited August 13, 2023 by regex

On 8/9/2023 at 1:16 PM, Superfluous J said:

I bought Darkest Dungeon 2 on the Steam Summer Sale, but hadn't had a chance to try it until last week.

It actually took a bit for me to get into it, mostly because I absolutely LOVED the original and this one is so different. However, I stuck with it and am glad I did. Once I stopped wanting to play the original (which I can always do by just playing it), I realized that it's nice to have a WHOLE DIFFERENT game with the same basic combat mechanics yet everything else changed.

Going in with five, coming out with a crazy six

For the past 2 days, I've been working on an early 20th century (specifically 1910s -1930s) style merchant ship in Minecraft Pocket Edition. I'm currently working on the bottom floor - making the engine parts. I tried making a boiler with actual fire. But it caught on fire (due to reasons I'll explain in a different thread, hehe)... Twice...

Picture of the vessel here, if you want to give me an exterior idea, tell me.

I've been playing a lot of modded Minecraft (Java, thanks for asking) recently. I started a new survival world, and its Day 18 and I've got a pretty good setup.

I found a cave on Day 1 and made it into my home. Now I have a farm and a well (those cobblestone stairs in the corner) that houses a 2x2 infinite water supply.

On Day 17 I tamed a dog and named him Lupin, after the Harry Potter character. Other than that, there's an armor stand in the left corner, that ladder, my bed, and some barrels.

In the basement, I have a crafting table, some double chests for storage, a stone cutter (for my building ventures) and some furnaces.

Here's the entrance to the Mineshaft. The ladder goes down to a nearly identical room where I strip-mine for iron.

If any other Minecrafters among us wonder what mods I'm using, I'm using Better Adventures+ by Flowstatevideo on CurseForge. It's a really good modpack and it supports the latest versions. It's only for Java, though.

Edited August 15, 2023 by TwoCalories
spellinf

Played more modded Minecraft.

I went sailing on a big river North of my base. I found a ruined portal and a village, which I went and looted. I didn't get anything more valuable then iron and an Efficiency I enchanting book.

I expanded my farms and planted wheat and potatoes in rows. I'm going to have to get more seeds to finish the farm.

Yes, that's my Minecraft avatar. It's custom made by me to look somewhat like myself.

Edited August 17, 2023 by TwoCalories
Nice Base

Edited August 17, 2023 by Royalswissarmyknife

My wife and I played "It Takes Two" last weekend. We started around 10pm and intended to stop around midnight.

We stopped when I noticed this weird light coming in from behind the drapes and realized it was after 6am.

But anyway, it was a good time. Looking forward to finishing it this weekend, hopefully before it ruins an entire night of sleep.
Took a brief break for some Zelda but Im back on Factorio. God combinator circuitry is a beautiful, blessed thing. This game is bottomless.
